operations.summary: Returns a list of all Monitor Provider objects

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: SCIM filter

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Specifies a property value by which to sort

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Specifies either ascending or descending alphabetical order

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: 1-based index of the first result to return

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Indicates the number of results per page

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to include in the response

parameters.name: excludeAttributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to exclude from the response

responseMessages.message: The requested operation succeeded
The requested operation succeeded and no further information has been provided, such as in the case of a DELETE operation.
The request contents are incorrectly formatted or the request was made for an invalid API version.
The requester cannot be authenticated
The requester does not have the required privileges or another constraint failed, such as attempting to delete an edit-only object.
The requested path does not refer to an existing object or object relation.

The requested operation could not be performed due to the current state of the configuration. For example, an attempt was made to create an object that already exists or an attempt was made to delete an object that is referred to by another object.
The request is such that the Accept header does not indicate that JSON is an acceptable format for a response.
The server encountered an unexpected error.

operations.summary: Add a new Monitor Provider to the config

parameters.description: Monitor Provider to add
parameters.name: add-monitor-provider-request
attributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to include in the response

parameters.name: excludeAttributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to exclude from the response

parameters.name: applyChangeTo
parameters.description: Specify whether to apply this configuration change to a single server or the whole server group. This does not apply to mirrored subtree objects

providerName.description: Name of the new Monitor Provider

extensionClass.description: The fully-qualified name of the Java class providing the logic for the Third Party Monitor Provider.

diskDevices.description: Specifies which disk devices to monitor for I/O activity. Should be the device name as displayed by iostat -d.

systemUtilizationMonitorLogDirectory.description: Specifies a relative or absolute path to the directory on the local filesystem containing the log files used by the system utilization monitor. The path must exist, and it must be a writable directory by the server process.

networkDevices.description: Specifies which network interfaces to monitor for I/O activity. Should be the device name as displayed by netstat -i.

description.description: A description for this Monitor Provider

lowSpaceWarningPercentThreshold.description: Specifies the low space warning threshold value as a percentage of total space. If the amount of usable disk space drops below this amount, then the Directory Server will begin generating warning alert notifications.

alertFrequency.description: Specifies the length of time between administrative alerts generated in response to lack of usable disk space. Administrative alerts will be generated whenever the amount of usable space drops below any threshold, and they will also be generated at regular intervals as long as the amount of usable space remains below the threshold value. A value of zero indicates that alerts should only be generated when the amount of usable space drops below a configured threshold.

lowSpaceWarningSizeThreshold.description: Specifies the low space warning threshold value as an absolute amount of space. If the amount of usable disk space drops below this amount, then the Directory Server will begin generating warning alert notifications.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the Monitor Provider is enabled for use.

extensionArgument.description: The set of arguments used to customize the behavior for the Third Party Monitor Provider. Each configuration property should be given in the form 'name=value'.

outOfSpaceErrorPercentThreshold.description: Specifies the out of space error threshold value as a percentage of total space. If the amount of usable disk space drops below this amount, then the Directory Server will shut itself down to avoid problems that may occur from complete exhaustion of usable space.

lowSpaceErrorSizeThreshold.description: Specifies the low space error threshold value as an absolute amount of space. If the amount of usable disk space drops below this amount, then the Directory Server will start rejecting operations requested by non-root users.

outOfSpaceErrorSizeThreshold.description: Specifies the out of space error threshold value as an absolute amount of space. If the amount of usable disk space drops below this amount, then the Directory Server will shut itself down to avoid problems that may occur from complete exhaustion of usable space.

lowSpaceErrorPercentThreshold.description: Specifies the low space error threshold value as a percentage of total space. If the amount of usable disk space drops below this amount, then the Directory Server will start rejecting operations requested by non-root users.
